page.title: 12ELMBRIDGE SHOPPING HABITS
page.content: This area is very rural with no shops and no regular public transport. There is a post office and a small general store nearby. The nearest town, Droitwich, is within 3 miles where most commodities can be bought, most people shop here for their food weekly or fortnightly, travelling in their own cars. Some people travel further to shop mostly to Worcester, Kidderminster or Bromsgrove. Two families shop once a month at a wholesale outlet. Many people use the local post office and store for bread and occassionally for items which may have been forgotten. Milk and papers are delivered to most houses. Some people also have deliveries of meat, bread, fruit, vegetables and soft drinks. Very few people in this area buy items from mail order catalouges.
